pull_request.title: fix(keeper): realm diff iteration, make it deterministic by sorting path
pull_request.body: Fix the nondeterministic issue that might be introduced by #4281 (storage deposit). The `processStorageDeposit` function iterates over a map, which can lead to nondeterministic behavior since maps themselves are nondeterministic. Although not optimal, the fix is to sort the realm path before iterating.

comment.body: I see the commit to address this issue. It's better, but still not quite right. I add a post where the slug is "slug/1". In the post, it shows the escaped "slug%2F1" . When you hover over the title, the URL is "http://127.0.0.1:8888/r/lou/blog:posts/slug/1" and when you click the title, it shows a 404 error. Maybe the URL should be "http://127.0.0.1:8888/r/lou/blog:posts/slug%252F1". Have the do the escaping at the right level.

pull_request.title: feat(example): refactor p/demo/blog
pull_request.body:
This PR is linked to the https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/4088 for scratching the old `/p/demo/blog` to make it better but still have it be compatible with the `gnoblo-cli`.

This is currently in `/p/lou/blog` as to start with a completely fresh package, the git diff is nicer to read this way.

These are the features:

Base:
- [x] Blog rendering with use of `mux` 
- [x] Filtering of tags through query --> `:tag/<tagname>`
- [x] Sorting alphabetically --> `?sort=alpha&order=asc`
- [x] Sorting from last updated --> `?sort=update&order=asc`


<details>
<summary>Added/modified:</summary>

- [x] Listing of all tags
    - [x] Add sorting options
    - [x] Number of posts
- [x] Listing of all authors
    - [x] Add sorting options
    - [x]  Number of posts
- [x] Listing in time ranges (start ‚Äì end)  --> `?start=<time>&end=<time>`
    - [x] time.RFC3339, // rfc3339 format
    - [x] "2006-01-02", // date only
    - [x] "2006-01",    // year and month
    - [x] "2006",       // year only
- [x] Filtering of authors like it has already been done for tags (through query) --> `:author/<authorname>`
- [x] Toggle grid and list mode for Rendering (using gno-columns) --> `?mode=grid` or `?mode=list`
- [x] Adding pagination
- [x] Updating comments based on comment ID
- [x] Switching to `seq.id` as indexes
- [x] Improve error handling and messages throughout the package.
- [x] Pinning comments
- [x] Resolve users via `r/sys/users` registry.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Further (not mentioned in issue):</summary>

- [x] Filtering of commenters like it has already been done for tags (through query) --> `:commenter/<commentername>`
- [x] Sorting from most/least recent (for **posts** and **filters**) --> `?sort=recent&order=asc`
- [x] Toggle time format -- **Is it necessary?**
- [x] Add likes to comments
- [x] Add replies to comments
- [x] Add likes to posts -- **Is it necessary?**
- [x] `Mention` method to simulate a link to a specific author/ commenter (will link to :author or :commenter)
- [x] Make sorting/toggling options customizable (to disable/ or select)
- [x] Add a customizable option for rendering previews (at home, to add actions)
- [ ] Add tests
    - [x] Base of testings with uassert and urequire
    - [ ] For all scenarios
- [x] Add moderation
    - [x] Formatting, checking user validity and resolving
    - [x] Assert users
    - [x] Try using authorizable package
- [x] Fix total replies for comments size + reply id are relative to comments
- [ ] Add more documentation
    - [ ] More doc.gno
    - [ ] Add comments
    - [ ] Document customisation of rendering
    - [ ] Document custom of toggling/sort headers
 - [x] Add realm example for the use of the package

</details>

Package created to support:
- https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/4477

labels.description: Tag used for new Realms or Packages.

pull_request.title: fix(keeper): realm diff iteration, make it deterministic by sorting path
pull_request.body: Fix the nondeterministic issue that might be introduced by #4281 (storage deposit). The `processStorageDeposit` function iterates over a map, which can lead to nondeterministic behavior since maps themselves are nondeterministic. Although not optimal, the fix is to sort the realm path before iterating.

Codecov provides highly integrated tools to group, merge, archive and compare coverage reports. Whether your team is comparing changes in a pull request or reviewing a single commit, Codecov will improve the code review workflow and quality.

## Code coverage done right.¬Æ

1. Upload coverage reports from your CI builds.
2. Codecov merges all builds and languages into one beautiful coherent report.
3. Get commit statuses, pull request comments and coverage overlay via our browser extension.

When Codecov merges your uploads it keeps track of the CI provider (inc. build details) and user specified context, e.g. `#unittest` ~ `#smoketest` or `#oldcode` ~ `#newcode`. You can track the `#unittest` coverage independently of other groups. [Learn more here](

**File backed configuration** all through the `codecov.yml`.

- Do you **support multiple languages** in the same project? **Yes**

issue.body:
This PR is linked to the https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/4088 for scratching the old `/p/demo/blog` to make it better but still have it be compatible with the `gnoblo-cli`.

This is currently in `/p/lou/blog` as to start with a completely fresh package, the git diff is nicer to read this way.

These are the features:

Base:
- [x] Blog rendering with use of `mux` 
- [x] Filtering of tags through query --> `:tag/<tagname>`
- [x] Sorting alphabetically --> `?sort=alpha&order=asc`
- [x] Sorting from last updated --> `?sort=update&order=asc`


<details>
<summary>Added/modified:</summary>

- [x] Listing of all tags
    - [x] Add sorting options
    - [x] Number of posts
- [x] Listing of all authors
    - [x] Add sorting options
    - [x]  Number of posts
- [x] Listing in time ranges (start ‚Äì end)  --> `?start=<time>&end=<time>`
    - [x] time.RFC3339, // rfc3339 format
    - [x] "2006-01-02", // date only
    - [x] "2006-01",    // year and month
    - [x] "2006",       // year only
- [x] Filtering of authors like it has already been done for tags (through query) --> `:author/<authorname>`
- [x] Toggle grid and list mode for Rendering (using gno-columns) --> `?mode=grid` or `?mode=list`
- [x] Adding pagination
- [x] Updating comments based on comment ID
- [x] Switching to `seq.id` as indexes
- [x] Improve error handling and messages throughout the package.
- [x] Pinning comments
- [x] Resolve users via `r/sys/users` registry.

</details>

<details>
<summary>Further (not mentioned in issue):</summary>

- [x] Filtering of commenters like it has already been done for tags (through query) --> `:commenter/<commentername>`
- [x] Sorting from most/least recent (for **posts** and **filters**) --> `?sort=recent&order=asc`
- [x] Toggle time format -- **Is it necessary?**
- [x] Add likes to comments
- [x] Add replies to comments
- [x] Add likes to posts -- **Is it necessary?**
- [x] `Mention` method to simulate a link to a specific author/ commenter (will link to :author or :commenter)
- [x] Make sorting/toggling options customizable (to disable/ or select)
- [x] Add a customizable option for rendering previews (at home, to add actions)
- [ ] Add tests
    - [x] Base of testings with uassert and urequire
    - [ ] For all scenarios
- [x] Add moderation
    - [x] Formatting, checking user validity and resolving
    - [x] Assert users
    - [x] Try using authorizable package
- [x] Fix total replies for comments size + reply id are relative to comments
- [ ] Add more documentation
    - [ ] More doc.gno
    - [ ] Add comments
    - [ ] Document customisation of rendering
    - [ ] Document custom of toggling/sort headers
 - [x] Add realm example for the use of the package

</details>

Package created to support:
- https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/4477

comment.body:
The realm page has options to filter the blog posts. As we discussed in the dev call, the Render function has a CPU limit. In this video, I did a stress test to demonstrate this limit. I also discuss possible mitigations, including warning the user when getting close to the limit.
https://www.loom.com/share/518211ca05664ac6b00a83704fcce34b

review.body:
I don't understand the point of ending a username with 3 digits (nor even starting it with 3 letters), but in any case, I think the error should be more explicit [here](https://github.com/gnolang/gno/blob/2a1e58772b0a5098ce7f34ba6dfc59da46d6eabc/examples/gno.land/r/gnoland/users/v1/users.gno#L39-L41).

Rather than checking if the username matches a regex and return a monolithic `invalid username` error, I would have checked the rules one by one and returned a clearer error, like:
- `the username cannot exceed 20 characters`
- `the username must start with 3 letters`
- `the username can only contain digits, lowercase letters, and underscores`
- etc.

pull_request.title: chore: update username registration rules
pull_request.body:
## Description

This PR drops the following rule from the namespace registration:
> Usernames should end with three numbers.

It took me ~15mins to figure out why I couldn't register any of these seemingly normal usernames:
- zmilos
- zmil0s
- zivkovicmilos0

Original criteria is here: https://github.com/gnolang/gno/issues/2827

Additionally, I've also added better valid case test support, because the previous valid "tests" were embarrassing

issue.body:
address #4538 

~This PR fixes a death loop that occurred when CreateEmptyBlocks was set to false. This issue caused a node to enter an infinite loop due to an impossible condition.~

**UPDATE**
The issue is actually deeper. This PR https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/2838 introduced dynamic gas price updates in the `EndBlocker` function. As a result, every block now alters the app `cs.state`, even empty blocks, because the gas price keeper adjusts the gas price based on block gas usage. 

Every block modifies the `AppHash` since the gas price state is updated in the `EndBlocker`. The `needProofBlock` function always returns true because `cs.state.AppHash != lastBlockMeta.Header.AppHash` is consistently true. 
This leads to an infinite loop when `CreateEmptyBlocks == false`, as the node continues to attempt to create proof blocks even when there are no transactions.

So a better fix is probably to make `EndBlocker` only update the gas price when there are transactions (when gas `consumption > 0`). cc @piux2 

fix 51cdf97b1b911dbb4f566311aee2487f0e159ed3

@zivkovicmilos can you double check this üôè ?

--- 

I need some help testing to ensure everything functions correctly. cc @jefft0  @mazzy89 @zivkovicmilos

pull_request.title: fix: compile regx before use
pull_request.body:
Because Compile() happens dynamically run-time, it can cause concurrent map writes: https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/4568

This PR fixes it by making sure the regexes we use at runtime are already compiled during init.

This improves efficiency by not requiring a map lookup each time.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -1546,6 +1546,11 @@ func (tv *TypedValue) ComputeMapKey(store Store, omitType bool) MapKey {
 		bz = append(bz, pbz...)
 	case *PointerType:
 		fillValueTV(store, tv)
+		// nil pointer.
+		if tv.V == nil {
+			bz = append(bz, nilStr...)
comment.body:
Let's use `nilStr` when we have interfaces.

For this case, I'd say the most correct is actually:

```
var x [sizeOfUintPtr]byte
bz = append(bz, x[:]...)
```

So that it's all 0 bytes, as nil pointers are.

issue.title: gnovm: using escape character "\x1b" in test.Run name crash

labels.name: üêû bug
labels.description: Something isn't working

issue.body: ## Using escape character ("\x1b" or "\033") in `t.Run` function in testing make testing crash ### Description you can not use a string that contains the escape character in the first arg of `t.Run` in a test file: ### Your environment go version: `go1.24.4 linux/amd64` uname: `Linux prout 5.15.167.4-microsoft-standard-WSL2 #1 SMP Tue Nov 5 00:21:55 UTC 2024 x86_64 GNU/Linux` distro `Debian` gno version: `ufmt-enhancement.2650+5afa07849` ### Steps to reproduce ```go package foo import "testing" func TestCrash(t *testing.T) { str := "\x1b[31mhello\x1b[m" println(str) // no crash t.Run(str, func(t *testing.T) { return }) } ``` ### Expected behaviour should just work like ``` === RUN TestCrash hello --- PASS: TestCrash (0.00s) ``` (hello would be in red) ### Actual behaviour ### Logs ``` panic: invalid slice index 1 > 0 Stacktrace: rewrite(name) testing/base/match.gno:0 t.Run(str,(const-type testing/base.testingFunc)(func(t *(typeval{testing/base.T})){ ... })) testing/base/testing.gno:162 fn(t<~VPBlock(1,0)>) gno.land/p/demo/ufmt/ufmt_test.gno:249 tRunner(t,test.F,verbose) testing/base/testing.gno:410 RunTest(,true,false,(const-type testing/base.InternalTest)) testing/base/testing.gno:319 ``` ### Proposed solution in testing.Run there is this function `rewrite` ```go func (t *T) Run(name string, f testingFunc) bool { fullName := t.name + "/" + rewrite(name) // here ... } that looks like this ```go func rewrite(s string) string { b := []byte{} for _, r := range s { switch { case isSpace(r): b = append(b, '_') case !unicode.IsPrint(r): s := simpleQuoteRune(r) // *here b = append(b, s[1:len(s)-1]...) default: b = append(b, string(r)...) } } return string(b) } ``` while debugging, the result of the `simpleQuoteRune` call (where is the `*here`) is `"."` when using the string with escape characters so when doing `s[1:len(s)-1]` its doing `(".")[1:1-1]` which is a range `[1:0]` and crashes with `panic: invalid slice index 1 > 0` why ? because the function simpleQuoteRune is litterally ```go // simpleQuoteRune does not follow the original strconv.QuoteRune. func simpleQuoteRune(r rune) string { return "." } ``` what is it used for ? why does someone coded this so this switch case will always crash ???

pull_request.title: fix(regx): prevent concurrent map writes in regx.Compile
pull_request.body:
Use a mutex to synchronize access to the shared regex cache map in regx.Compile.

This fixes a fatal runtime error caused by concurrent map writes when
Compile is called in parallel:
```
fatal error: concurrent map writes

goroutine 31 [running]:
internal/runtime/maps.fatal({0xb3a2ed?, 0xa81d80?})
	/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/golang.org/toolchain@v0.0.1-go1.24.1.linux-amd64/src/runtime/panic.go:1058 +0x18
github.com/gnolang/gno/tm2/pkg/regx.regx.Compile(...)
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/tm2/pkg/regx/regx.go:21
github.com/gnolang/gno/tm2/pkg/regx.regx.Match({0xc000032120?, 0x48fd1d?}, {0xc00011e4fb, 0x3})
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/tm2/pkg/regx/regx.go:51 +0x11e
github.com/gnolang/gno/gnovm/pkg/gnolang.IsStdlib(...)
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/gnovm/pkg/gnolang/mempackage.go:138
github.com/gnolang/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler.PackageDirLocation({0xc00011e4fb, 0x3})
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler/transpiler.go:41 +0x89
github.com/gnolang/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler.(*transpileCtx).transformFile(0xc000257110, 0xc000272300, 0xc0002603c0)
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler/transpiler.go:170 +0x5a9
github.com/gnolang/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler.Transpile({0xb587fe, 0xdc}, {0x0, 0x0}, {0xc000026640, 0x35})
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler/transpiler.go:112 +0x465
github.com/gnolang/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler.TestTranspile.func1(0xc000287c00)
	/home/runner/work/gno/gno/gnovm/pkg/transpiler/transpiler_test.go:423 +0x9e
testing.tRunner(0xc000287c00, 0xc00044e900)
	/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/golang.org/toolchain@v0.0.1-go1.24.1.linux-amd64/src/testing/testing.go:1792 +0xf4
created by testing.(*T).Run in goroutine 11
	/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/golang.org/toolchain@v0.0.1-go1.24.1.linux-amd64/src/testing/testing.go:1851 +0x413
```

The issue was encountered during CI on this run:
https://github.com/gnolang/gno/actions/runs/16492984289/job/46631959350#step:4:102

Multiple goroutines were calling regx.Compile concurrently via IsStdlib and
PackageDirLocation, leading to unsafe writes to the shared map.

A sync.RWMutex is now used to ensure safe concurrent access.

	/home/runner/go/pkg/mod/golang.org/toolchain@v0.0.1-go1.24.1.linux-amd64/src/testing/testing.go:1851 +0x413
```

The issue was encountered during CI on this run:
https://github.com/gnolang/gno/actions/runs/16492984289/job/46631959350#step:4:102

Multiple goroutines were calling regx.Compile concurrently via IsStdlib and
PackageDirLocation, leading to unsafe writes to the shared map.

A sync.RWMutex is now used to ensure safe concurrent access.

comment.body:
These regexes are used in many hot paths, and it would make it slower to capture these within mutexes.

I'm making an alternative PR to compile the regexes at program init, as it should be: https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/4576

pull_request.title: fix: compile regx before use
pull_request.body:
Because Compile() happens dynamically run-time, it can cause concurrent map writes: https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/4568

This PR fixes it by making sure the regexes we use at runtime are already compiled during init.

This improves efficiency by not requiring a map lookup each time.

We need a generic anti-squatting system for `r/sys/users` to set up an automatic auction system. This will prevent squatting and ensure fair access. Initially, `r/sys/users` will remain invite-only.

How to Contribute: Submit a plan in plain English or pseudo code outlining the design of the anti-squatting system. Focus on creating a generic, importable library or realm. We will review the design before moving to full implementation.

Related: #2189 #2827

fix issue #2727

commits.message:
fix(cs): death loop when `CreateEmptyBlocks==false` (#4564)

address #4538 

~This PR fixes a death loop that occurred when CreateEmptyBlocks was set
to false. This issue caused a node to enter an infinite loop due to an
impossible condition.~

**UPDATE**
The issue is actually deeper. This PR
https://github.com/gnolang/gno/pull/2838 introduced dynamic gas price
updates in the `EndBlocker` function. As a result, every block now
alters the app `cs.state`, even empty blocks, because the gas price
keeper adjusts the gas price based on block gas usage.

Every block modifies the `AppHash` since the gas price state is updated
in the `EndBlocker`. The `needProofBlock` function always returns true
because `cs.state.AppHash != lastBlockMeta.Header.AppHash` is
consistently true.
This leads to an infinite loop when `CreateEmptyBlocks == false`, as the
node continues to attempt to create proof blocks even when there are no
transactions.

So a better fix is probably to make `EndBlocker` only update the gas
price when there are transactions (when gas `consumption > 0`). cc
@piux2

fix 51cdf97b1b911dbb4f566311aee2487f0e159ed3

@zivkovicmilos can you double check this üôè ?

--- 

I need some help testing to ensure everything functions correctly. cc
@jefft0 @mazzy89 @zivkovicmilos
